verses.verse: And the LORD<WH3068> spoke<WH1696> to Moses<WH4872> and Aaron,<WH175> saying,<WH559>

When<WH3588> a man<WH120> shall have<WH1961> in the skin<WH5785> of his flesh<WH1320> a rising,<WH7613> a scab,<WH5597> or<WH176> bright<WH934> spot,<WH934> and it be in the skin<WH5785> of his flesh<WH1320> like the plague<WH5061> of leprosy;<WH6883> then he shall be brought<WH935> to Aaron<WH175> the priest,<WH3548> or<WH176> to one<WH259> of his sons<WH1121> the priests:<WH3548>

And the priest<WH3548> shall look<WH7200> on the plague<WH5061> in the skin<WH5785> of the flesh:<WH1320> and when the hair<WH8181> in the plague<WH5061> is turned<WH2015> white,<WH3836> and the plague<WH5061> in sight<WH4758> be deeper<WH6013> than the skin<WH5785> of his flesh,<WH1320> it is a plague<WH5061> of leprosy:<WH6883> and the priest<WH3548> shall look<WH7200> on him, and pronounce him unclean.<WH2930>

If<WH518> the bright<WH934> spot<WH934> be white<WH3836> in the skin<WH5785> of his flesh,<WH1320> and in sight<WH4758> be not deeper<WH6013> than the skin,<WH5785> and the hair<WH8181> thereof be not turned<WH2015> white;<WH3836> then the priest<WH3548> shall shut<WH5462> up him that has the plague<WH5061> seven<WH7651> days:<WH3117>

And the priest<WH3548> shall look<WH7200> on him the seventh<WH7637> day:<WH3117> and, behold,<WH2009> if the plague<WH5061> in his sight<WH5869> be at a stay,<WH5975> and the plague<WH5061> spread<WH6581> not in the skin;<WH5785> then the priest<WH3548> shall shut<WH5462> him up seven<WH7651> days<WH3117> more:<WH8145>

And the priest<WH3548> shall look<WH7200> on him again<WH8145> the seventh<WH7637> day:<WH3117> and, behold,<WH2009> if the plague<WH5061> be somewhat<WH3544> dark,<WH3544> and the plague<WH5061> spread<WH6581> not in the skin,<WH5785> the priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him clean:<WH2891> it is but a scab:<WH4556> and he shall wash<WH3526> his clothes,<WH899> and be clean.<WH2891>

But if<WH518> the scab<WH4556> spread<WH6581> much<WH6581> abroad<WH6581> in the skin,<WH5785> after<WH310> that he has been seen<WH7200> of the priest<WH3548> for his cleansing,<WH2893> he shall be seen<WH7200> of the priest<WH3548> again.<WH8145>
And if the priest<WH3548> see<WH7200> that, behold,<WH2009> the scab<WH4556> spreads<WH6581> in the skin,<WH5785> then the priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him unclean:<WH2930> it is a leprosy.<WH6883>
When<WH3588> the plague<WH5061> of leprosy<WH6883> is in a man,<WH120> then he shall be brought<WH935> to the priest;<WH3548>

And the priest<WH3548> shall see<WH7200> him: and, behold,<WH2009> if the rising<WH7613> be white<WH3836> in the skin,<WH5785> and it have turned<WH2015> the hair<WH8181> white,<WH3836> and there be quick<WH4241> raw<WH2416> flesh<WH1320> in the rising;<WH7613>

It is an old<WH3462> leprosy<WH6883> in the skin<WH5785> of his flesh,<WH1320> and the priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him unclean,<WH2930> and shall not shut<WH5462> him up: for he is unclean.<WH2931>

And if<WH518> a leprosy<WH6883> break<WH6524> out abroad<WH6524> in the skin,<WH5785> and the leprosy<WH6883> cover<WH3680> all<WH3605> the skin<WH5785> of him that has the plague<WH5061> from his head<WH7218> even to his foot,<WH7272> wherever<WH3605> the priest<WH3548> looks;<WH4758>

Then the priest<WH3548> shall consider:<WH7200> and, behold,<WH2009> if the leprosy<WH6883> have covered<WH3680> all<WH3605> his flesh,<WH1320> he shall pronounce him clean<WH2891> that has the plague:<WH5061> it is all<WH3605> turned<WH2015> white:<WH3836> he is clean.<WH2889>
But when<WH3117> raw<WH2416> flesh<WH1320> appears<WH7200> in him, he shall be unclean.<WH2930>
And the priest<WH3548> shall see<WH7200> the raw<WH2416> flesh,<WH1320> and pronounce him to be unclean:<WH2930> for the raw<WH2416> flesh<WH1320> is unclean:<WH2931> it is a leprosy.<WH6883>
Or<WH176> if<WH3588> the raw<WH2416> flesh<WH1320> turn<WH7725> again,<WH7725> and be changed<WH2015> to white,<WH3836> he shall come<WH935> to the priest;<WH3548>

And the priest<WH3548> shall see<WH7200> him: and, behold,<WH2009> if the plague<WH5061> be turned<WH2015> into white;<WH3836> then the priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him clean<WH2891> that has the plague:<WH5061> he is clean.<WH2889>
The flesh<WH1320> also, in which, even in the skin<WH5785> thereof, was a boil,<WH7822> and is healed,<WH7495>

And in the place<WH4725> of the boil<WH7822> there be a white<WH3836> rising,<WH7613> or<WH176> a bright<WH934> spot,<WH934> white,<WH3836> and somewhat reddish,<WH125> and it be showed<WH7200> to the priest;<WH3548>

And if, when the priest<WH3548> sees<WH7200> it, behold,<WH2009> it be in sight<WH4758> lower<WH8217> than the skin,<WH5785> and the hair<WH8181> thereof be turned<WH2015> white;<WH3836> the priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him unclean:<WH2930> it is a plague<WH5061> of leprosy<WH6883> broken<WH6524> out of the boil.<WH7822>

But if<WH518> the priest<WH3548> look<WH7200> on it, and, behold,<WH2009> there be no<WH369> white<WH3836> hairs<WH8181> therein, and if<WH518> it be not lower<WH8217> than<WH4480> the skin,<WH5785> but be somewhat<WH3544> dark;<WH3544> then the priest<WH3548> shall shut<WH5462> him up seven<WH7651> days:<WH3117>
And if<WH518> it spread<WH6581> much<WH6581> abroad<WH6581> in the skin,<WH5785> then the priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him unclean:<WH2930> it is a plague.<WH5061>
But if<WH518> the bright<WH934> spot<WH934> stay<WH5975> in his place, and spread<WH6581> not, it is a burning<WH6867> boil;<WH7822> and the priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him clean.<WH2891>

Or<WH176> if<WH3588> there be any flesh,<WH1320> in the skin<WH5785> whereof there is a hot<WH784> burning,<WH4348> and the quick<WH4241> flesh that burns<WH4348> have<WH1961> a white<WH3836> bright<WH934> spot,<WH934> somewhat reddish,<WH125> or<WH176> white;<WH3836>

Then the priest<WH3548> shall look<WH7200> on it: and, behold,<WH2009> if the hair<WH8181> in the bright<WH934> spot<WH934> be turned<WH2015> white,<WH3836> and it be in sight<WH4758> deeper<WH6013> than<WH4480> the skin;<WH5785> it is a leprosy<WH6883> broken<WH6524> out of the burning:<WH4348> why the priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him unclean:<WH2930> it is the plague<WH5061> of leprosy.<WH6883>

But if the priest<WH3548> look<WH7200> on it, and, behold,<WH2009> there be no<WH369> white<WH3836> hair<WH8181> in the bright<WH934> spot,<WH934> and it be no<WH369> lower<WH8217> than<WH4480> the other skin,<WH5785> but be somewhat<WH3544> dark;<WH3544> then the priest<WH3548> shall shut<WH5462> him up seven<WH7651> days:<WH3117>

And the priest<WH3548> shall look<WH7200> on him the seventh<WH7637> day:<WH3117> and if<WH518> it be spread<WH6581> much<WH6581> abroad<WH6581> in the skin,<WH5785> then the priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him unclean:<WH2930> it is the plague<WH5061> of leprosy.<WH6883>

And if<WH518> the bright<WH934> spot<WH934> stay<WH5975> in his place,<WH8478> and spread<WH6581> not in the skin,<WH5785> but it be somewhat<WH3544> dark;<WH3544> it is a rising<WH7613> of the burning,<WH4348> and the priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him clean:<WH2891> for it is an inflammation<WH6867> of the burning.<WH4348>
If<WH3588> a man<WH376> or<WH176> woman<WH802> have<WH1961> a plague<WH5061> on the head<WH7218> or<WH176> the beard;<WH2206>

Then the priest<WH3548> shall see<WH7200> the plague:<WH5061> and, behold,<WH2009> if<WH3588> it be in sight<WH4758> deeper<WH6013> than<WH4480> the skin;<WH5785> and there be in it a yellow<WH6669> thin<WH1851> hair;<WH8181> then the priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him unclean:<WH2930> it is a dry<WH5424> scale,<WH5424> even a leprosy<WH6883> on the head<WH7218> or<WH176> beard.<WH2206>

And if<WH3588> the priest<WH3548> look<WH7200> on the plague<WH5061> of the scale,<WH5424> and, behold,<WH2009> it be not in sight<WH4758> deeper<WH6013> than<WH4480> the skin,<WH5785> and that there is no<WH369> black<WH7838> hair<WH8181> in it; then the priest<WH3548> shall shut<WH5462> up him that has the plague<WH5061> of the scale<WH5424> seven<WH7651> days:<WH3117>

And in the seventh<WH7637> day<WH3117> the priest<WH3548> shall look<WH7200> on the plague:<WH5061> and, behold,<WH2009> if the scale<WH5424> spread<WH6581> not, and there be in it no<WH3808> yellow<WH6669> hair,<WH8181> and the scale<WH5424> be not in sight<WH4758> deeper<WH6013> than<WH4480> the skin;<WH5785>
He shall be shaven,<WH1548> but the scale<WH5424> shall he not shave;<WH1548> and the priest<WH3548> shall shut<WH5462> up him that has the scale<WH5424> seven<WH7651> days<WH3117> more:<WH8145>

And in the seventh<WH7637> day<WH3117> the priest<WH3548> shall look<WH7200> on the scale:<WH5424> and, behold,<WH2009> if the scale<WH5424> be not spread<WH6581> in the skin,<WH5785> nor be in sight<WH4758> deeper<WH6013> than<WH4480> the skin;<WH5785> then the priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him clean:<WH2891> and he shall wash<WH3526> his clothes,<WH899> and be clean.<WH2891>
But if<WH3588> the scale<WH5424> spread<WH6581> much<WH6581> in the skin<WH5785> after<WH310> his cleansing;<WH2893>

Then the priest<WH3548> shall look<WH7200> on him: and, behold,<WH2009> if the scale<WH5424> be spread<WH6581> in the skin,<WH5785> the priest<WH3548> shall not seek<WH1239> for yellow<WH6669> hair;<WH8181> he is unclean.<WH2931>

But if<WH518> the scale<WH5424> be in his sight<WH5869> at a stay,<WH5975> and that there is black<WH7838> hair<WH8181> grown<WH6779> up therein; the scale<WH5424> is healed,<WH7495> he is clean:<WH2889> and the priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him clean.<WH2891>
If a man<WH376> also or<WH176> a woman<WH802> have<WH1961> in the skin<WH5785> of their flesh<WH1320> bright<WH934> spots,<WH934> even white<WH3836> bright<WH934> spots;<WH934>

Then the priest<WH3548> shall look:<WH7200> and, behold,<WH2009> if the bright<WH934> spots<WH934> in the skin<WH5785> of their flesh<WH1320> be darkish<WH3544> white;<WH3836> it is a freckled<WH933> spot<WH933> that grows<WH6524> in the skin;<WH5785> he is clean.<WH2889>
And the man<WH376> whose<WH3588> hair<WH4803> is fallen<WH4803> off his head,<WH7218> he is bald;<WH7142> yet is he clean.<WH2889>
And he that has his hair<WH4803> fallen<WH4803> off from the part of his head<WH7218> toward his face,<WH6440> he is forehead<WH1371> bald:<WH1371> yet is he clean.<WH2889>

And if<WH3588> there be in the bald<WH7146> head, or<WH176> bald<WH1372> forehead,<WH1372> a white<WH3836> reddish<WH125> sore;<WH5061> it is a leprosy<WH6883> sprung<WH6524> up in his bald<WH7146> head, or<WH176> his bald<WH1372> forehead.<WH1372>

Then the priest<WH3548> shall look<WH7200> on it: and, behold,<WH2009> if the rising<WH7613> of the sore<WH5061> be white<WH3836> reddish<WH125> in his bald<WH7146> head, or<WH176> in his bald<WH1372> forehead,<WH1372> as the leprosy<WH6883> appears<WH4758> in the skin<WH5785> of the flesh;<WH1320>
He is a leprous<WH6879> man,<WH376> he is unclean:<WH2931> the priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him utterly unclean;<WH2930> his plague<WH5061> is in his head.<WH7218>

And the leper<WH6879> in whom<WH834> the plague<WH5061> is, his clothes<WH899> shall be rent,<WH6533> and his head<WH7218> bore,<WH6544> and he shall put a covering<WH5844> on his upper<WH8222> lip,<WH8222> and shall cry,<WH7121> Unclean,<WH2931> unclean.<WH2931>

All<WH3605> the days<WH3117> wherein<WH834> the plague<WH5061> shall be in him he shall be defiled;<WH2930> he is unclean:<WH2931> he shall dwell<WH3427> alone;<WH909> without<WH2351> the camp<WH4264> shall his habitation<WH4186> be.
The garment<WH899> also that the plague<WH5061> of leprosy<WH6883> is in, whether it be a woolen<WH6785> garment,<WH899> or<WH176> a linen<WH6593> garment;<WH899>

Whether<WH176> it be in the warp,<WH8359> or<WH176> woof;<WH6154> of linen,<WH6593> or<WH176> of woolen;<WH6785> whether<WH176> in a skin,<WH5785> or<WH176> in any<WH3605> thing<WH4399> made<WH4399> of skin;<WH5785>

And if the plague<WH5061> be greenish<WH3422> or<WH176> reddish<WH125> in the garment,<WH899> or<WH176> in the skin,<WH5785> either<WH176> in the warp,<WH8359> or<WH176> in the woof,<WH6154> or<WH176> in any<WH3605> thing<WH3627> of skin;<WH5785> it is a plague<WH5061> of leprosy,<WH6883> and shall be showed<WH7200> to the priest:<WH3548>
And the priest<WH3548> shall look<WH7200> on the plague,<WH5061> and shut<WH5462> up it that has the plague<WH5061> seven<WH7651> days:<WH3117>

And he shall look<WH7200> on the plague<WH5061> on the seventh<WH7637> day:<WH3117> if<WH3588> the plague<WH5061> be spread<WH6581> in the garment,<WH899> either<WH176> in the warp,<WH8359> or<WH176> in the woof,<WH6154> or<WH176> in a skin,<WH5785> or in any<WH3605> work<WH4399> that is made<WH6213> of skin;<WH5785> the plague<WH5061> is a fretting<WH3992> leprosy;<WH6883> it is unclean.<WH2931>

He shall therefore burn<WH8313> that garment,<WH899> whether<WH176> warp<WH8359> or<WH176> woof,<WH6154> in woolen<WH6785> or<WH176> in linen,<WH6593> or<WH176> any<WH3605> thing<WH3627> of skin,<WH5785> wherein<WH834> the plague<WH5061> is: for it is a fretting<WH3992> leprosy;<WH6883> it shall be burnt<WH8313> in the fire.<WH784>

And if<WH518> the priest<WH3548> shall look,<WH7200> and, behold,<WH2009> the plague<WH5061> be not spread<WH6581> in the garment,<WH899> either<WH176> in the warp,<WH8359> or<WH176> in the woof,<WH6154> or<WH176> in any<WH3605> thing<WH3627> of skin;<WH5785>
Then the priest<WH3548> shall command<WH6680> that they wash<WH3526> the thing wherein<WH834> the plague<WH5061> is, and he shall shut<WH5462> it up seven<WH7651> days<WH3117> more:<WH8145>

And if the priest<WH3548> look,<WH7200> and, behold,<WH2009> the plague<WH5061> be somewhat<WH3544> dark<WH3544> after<WH310> the washing<WH3526> of it; then he shall rend<WH7167> it out of the garment,<WH899> or<WH176> out of the skin,<WH5785> or<WH176> out of the warp,<WH8359> or<WH176> out of the woof:<WH6154>

And the garment,<WH899> either<WH176> warp,<WH8359> or<WH176> woof,<WH6154> or<WH176> whatever<WH3605> thing<WH3627> of skin<WH5785> it be, which<WH834> you shall wash,<WH3526> if the plague<WH5061> be departed<WH5493> from them, then it shall be washed<WH3526> the second<WH8145> time, and shall be clean.<WH2891>

This<WH2063> is the law<WH8451> of the plague<WH5061> of leprosy<WH6883> in a garment<WH899> of woolen<WH6785> or<WH176> linen,<WH6593> either<WH176> in the warp,<WH8359> or<WH176> woof,<WH6154> or<WH176> any<WH3605> thing<WH3627> of skins,<WH5785> to pronounce it clean,<WH2891> or<WH176> to pronounce it unclean.<WH2930>
